reasoning: The transcription provides a step-by-step guide on how to prepare a chicken dish with a mayonnaise and hot sauce coating, inspired by Jacques Pepin's friend Suzy. The steps are extracted based on the sequence of actions described by Jacques, starting from seasoning the chicken to baking it in the oven.
dish_description: The dish is a baked chicken breast coated with a spicy mayonnaise mixture, which is expected to result in a moist and flavorful meat.

cooking_steps.description: Season two chicken breasts with half a teaspoon of salt.
Apply a good teaspoon of hot sauce, specifically garlic chili sauce, underneath the skin of the chicken.
Place the seasoned chicken breasts into a gratin dish.
In a separate bowl, mix a third of a cup of mayonnaise with a good teaspoon of hot sauce.
Ensure the chicken is slightly dried out before coating it generously with the mayonnaise mixture on top.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for approximately 25 minutes.
Serve the chicken, ensuring to highlight its moistness and the nice sauce created during baking.
